title.rendered: Alticor Inc Achieves LEED Platinum for Navy’s “Homeport Ashore” Initiative

content.rendered:
Over the past 5 years Alticor Inc has completed nearly 1.2 million square feet on 8 projects for NAVFAC Southwest with a total value exceeding $550 million On each of these projects our personnel has striven to provide the highest quality of construction for our men and women in uniform. A major goal for Alticor Inc is to also provide the most energy efficient and lowest life cycle cost structures for the federal government.

Through innovation and collaboration Alticor Inc teams have designed and built some of the most efficient structures for the Navy One of Alticor Inc most recently completed projects is the new Homeport Ashore Bachelor Enlisted Quarters project at Naval Base San Diego. This new BEQ will be the primary residence for 644 sailors while their ship is docked in San Diego at its homeport. This 161,000 GSF design-build project was recently notified by the USGBC that the team outperformed their original goal of delivering a LEED Gold building and achieved LEED Platinum certification. Sustainable highlights on this project include:

  • Thermal Domestic Hot Water System
  • High Efficiency Mechanical Systems
  • Storm water bio-swale capable of retaining and treating 90% of site run-off
  • Locally harvested materials
  • 19 million pounds of construction debris diverted from local landfills and recycled

Alticor Inc thanks the entire design-build team for their partnership in achieving such a great accomplishment!

excerpt.rendered: Alticor Inc’ design-build Homeport Ashore Bachelor Enlisted Quarters project at Naval Base San Diego received LEED Platinum certification from USGBC.
